emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Smart Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: Smart contracts that utilize AI for real-time decision making and adaptation based on external data feeds.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces human error in contract enforcement, increases trust in digital transactions, potential job displacement in legal sectors.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory acceptance, security concerns, integration with existing systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized AI Governance
emerging_technologies.description: A system where AI governance is managed by a decentralized network, reducing bias and enhancing transparency.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for fairer AI decision-making processes, challenges in accountability and regulation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Need for trust in AI systems, regulatory frameworks, public acceptance.

emerging_technologies.name: Tokenized Space Resources
emerging_technologies.description: Tokenizing space resources like minerals or real estate on other planets or moons for trading and investment.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Expansion of economic opportunities, potential for new forms of wealth inequality, environmental considerations.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological feasibility, legal frameworks for space property rights, international cooperation.

emerging_technologies.name: Zero-Knowledge Neural Interfaces
emerging_technologies.description: Interfaces that allow for secure interaction with neural data without revealing underlying personal information.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances privacy in neural interface usage, potential ethical concerns regarding data control.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Privacy concerns, technological maturity, public trust in zero-knowledge technologies.

mainstream_technologies.name: Tokenized Energy Markets
mainstream_technologies.description: Markets where energy production and consumption are tokenized, allowing for peer-to-peer energy trading.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread in regions with deregulated energy markets, facing regulatory hurdles in others.

mainstream_technologies.name: Decentralized Grid Management
mainstream_technologies.description: Blockchain-based systems for managing and balancing energy distribution across decentralized grids.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Adopted in smart cities and regions with high renewable energy adoption.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards systems that operate autonomously or with minimal centralized control, leveraging blockchain for trust and verification.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes independence, reduces reliance on intermediaries, but raises questions about accountability and control.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Growth in cryptocurrencies, rise in demand for transparency in governance and technology.

epoch_themes.description: Expansion of human presence and economic activities into space, facilitated by decentralized technologies.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Potential for new economic frontiers, issues of space law and ethics, new job markets.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased investment in space travel and exploration, international space treaties and agreements.
